column4: how would I check that? I am running over ethernet 100base-T with 2 switches in the network
could I transfer a file and watch iftop to get an idea or is there an easier way to see the speed?
i don't have it installed. is it in the repos?

ok. MAN, i hate that. I run x11vnc on the computer I am doing the makedvd command on and sometimes when I am in Terminal Server Client (jaunty) connected using VNC protocol, i'll be entering a command in the terminal and it's like a key gets stuck and it'll just keep entering letters. this last time it was an 'e'. no matter what I can't stop the machine from entering an 'e'. it'll do it in a new terminal if I open one. the only wa
ok, back at hand. the machine has restarted. so just install midnight commander from the repos?
ok i think thats enough speed
just wanted to make sure ur samba behaves not like mine: mynie is very slow
myine=mine
i wonder how makedvd works? is it trying to save tmp files to that smb share and that's what's causing the io error?
maybe i dont know makedvd
i m afk now
check read and write privilidges with ur smb mnt when accessing as non rott, thats how u run makedvd, right?
now really afk
the permissions on the /mnt/ directory are 777 and it owned by root. that's where I mounted the smb share. I have already confirmed I can mkdir and touch a file on the folder.
ok
so no idea after all
ok. i'll just copy the folders over locally and then try to run makedvd again.

i didn't realize nautilus is showing me the speed also. it's showing 6.1 MB/sec as I am transferring the VIDEO_TS and AUDIO_TS folders and storing them locally.
